extendedIngredients.name: green beans
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 cups stemmed and chopped fresh green beans

extendedIngredients.name: orange bell pepper
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 yellow or orange bell pepper, stemmed, seeded, and sliced into strips

extendedIngredients.name: red bell pepper
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 red bell pepper, stemmed, seeded, and sliced into strips

extendedIngredients.name: scallions
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/2 cup chopped scallions (sliced diagonally) OR chopped cilantro

extendedIngredients.name: skinless boneless chicken thighs
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 pound boneless, skinless chicken thighs or breasts, sliced into strips

extendedIngredients.name: teriyaki sauce
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/3 cup clean-eating teriyaki sauce, divided, homemade or store-bought

recipes.title: Stir-Fry Sesame Chicken

winePairing.pairingText: Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, and Sauvignon Blanc are great choices for Chicken. White meat is typically paired with white wine as to not overpower the flavor of the meat, so chardonnay and sauvignon blanc are safe choices. Chicken prepared with a tomato sauce or certainly a red wine sauce can and should be served with a red like a pinot noir. The Buddha Kat Winery Chardonnay with a 4 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 25 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Buddha Kat Winery Chardonnay
productMatches.description: We barrel ferment our Chardonnay and age it in a mix of Oak and Stainless. Giving this light bodied wine modest oak character, a delicate floral aroma, and a warming finish.

recipes.instructions: Toast sesame seeds in a dry skillet over medium heat, stirring frequently.Set aside.Coat chicken strips in 3 tablespoons of teriyaki sauce. Add oil to a pan or wok over medium heat. Cook for about 4-5 minutes per side until golden and cooked through. Set aside.Add green beans and water or stock to the pan. Cover and cook for about 5 minutes, until beans are crisp-tender. Add sesame oil and peppers to the pan with the beans. Cook uncovered for about 4 minutes. Add garlic and cook for an additional 30 seconds.Return chicken to pan and add remaining teriyaki sauce. Cook for one minute, until warmed. Remove from heat and sprinkle with toasted sesame seeds. Garnish with scallions or cilantro.Serve with brown rice or noodles.Enjoy!

steps.step: Toast sesame seeds in a dry skillet over medium heat, stirring frequently.Set aside.Coat chicken strips in 3 tablespoons of teriyaki sauce.
Add oil to a pan or wok over medium heat. Cook for about 4-5 minutes per side until golden and cooked through. Set aside.
Add green beans and water or stock to the pan. Cover and cook for about 5 minutes, until beans are crisp-tender.
Add sesame oil and peppers to the pan with the beans. Cook uncovered for about 4 minutes.
Add garlic and cook for an additional 30 seconds.Return chicken to pan and add remaining teriyaki sauce. Cook for one minute, until warmed.
Remove from heat and sprinkle with toasted sesame seeds.
Serve with brown rice or noodles.Enjoy!
